trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for mobile device enrollment | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for mobile device enrollment | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Set up mobile device management (MDM) prerequisites and get ready to enroll different operating systems.
trans-unit.target: Set up mobile device management (MDM) prerequisites and get ready to enroll different operating systems.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for mobile device management in Intune
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for mobile device management in Intune

trans-unit.source: To let employees enroll mobile devices (including [Android](set-up-android-management-with-microsoft-intune.md), [iOS and Mac](set-up-ios-and-mac-management-with-microsoft-intune.md), [Windows Phone](set-up-windows-phone-management-with-microsoft-intune.md), and [Windows PCs](set-up-windows-device-management-with-microsoft-intune.md)) with Intune or to manage company-owned devices you must enable device enrollment.
trans-unit.target: To let employees enroll mobile devices (including [Android](set-up-android-management-with-microsoft-intune.md), [iOS and Mac](set-up-ios-and-mac-management-with-microsoft-intune.md), [Windows Phone](set-up-windows-phone-management-with-microsoft-intune.md), and [Windows PCs](set-up-windows-device-management-with-microsoft-intune.md)) with Intune or to manage company-owned devices you must enable device enrollment.

trans-unit.source: To allow enrollment, you must set a mobile device management (MDM) authority, configure the Intune Company Portal, assign licenses, and enable enrollment for the device platform.
trans-unit.target: To allow enrollment, you must set a mobile device management (MDM) authority, configure the Intune Company Portal, assign licenses, and enable enrollment for the device platform.

trans-unit.source: Set mobile device management authority
trans-unit.target: Set mobile device management authority

trans-unit.source: The MDM authority defines the management service that has permission to manage a set of devices.
trans-unit.target: The MDM authority defines the management service that has permission to manage a set of devices.

trans-unit.source: The options for the MDM authority include Intune by itself and Configuration Manager with Intune.
trans-unit.target: The options for the MDM authority include Intune by itself and Configuration Manager with Intune.

trans-unit.source: If you set Configuration Manager as the management authority, no other service can be used for mobile device management.
trans-unit.target: If you set Configuration Manager as the management authority, no other service can be used for mobile device management.

trans-unit.source: Consider carefully whether you want to manage mobile devices by using Intune only (online service) or System Center Configuration Manager with Intune (on-premises software solution in conjunction with the online service).
trans-unit.target: Consider carefully whether you want to manage mobile devices by using Intune only (online service) or System Center Configuration Manager with Intune (on-premises software solution in conjunction with the online service).

trans-unit.source: After you set the mobile device management authority, this cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: After you set the mobile device management authority, this cannot be changed.

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Mobile Device Management**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Tasks** list, click **Set Mobile Device Management Authority**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Tasks** list, click **Set Mobile Device Management Authority**.

trans-unit.source: The **Set MDM Authority** dialog box opens.
trans-unit.target: The **Set MDM Authority** dialog box opens.

trans-unit.source: Set MDM authority dialog box
trans-unit.target: Set MDM authority dialog box

trans-unit.source: Intune requests confirmation that you want Intune as your MDM authority.
trans-unit.target: Intune requests confirmation that you want Intune as your MDM authority.

trans-unit.source: Select the check box, and then choose **Yes** to use Microsoft Intune to manage mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Select the check box, and then choose **Yes** to use Microsoft Intune to manage mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Intune Company Portal
trans-unit.target: Configure the Intune Company Portal

trans-unit.source: The Intune Company Portal is where users access company data and can do common tasks like enrolling devices, installing apps, and locating information for assistance from your IT department.
trans-unit.target: The Intune Company Portal is where users access company data and can do common tasks like enrolling devices, installing apps, and locating information for assistance from your IT department.

trans-unit.source: When you customize the Company Portal, the configurations apply to both the Company Portal website and Company Portal apps.
trans-unit.target: When you customize the Company Portal, the configurations apply to both the Company Portal website and Company Portal apps.

trans-unit.source: Customizing the Company Portal helps to provide a familiar and helpful experience for your end users.
trans-unit.target: Customizing the Company Portal helps to provide a familiar and helpful experience for your end users.

trans-unit.source: To do this, just sign in to the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com) as a tenant or service administrator, choose **Admin** > **Company Portal**, and configure the Company Portal settings.
trans-unit.target: To do this, just sign in to the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com) as a tenant or service administrator, choose **Admin** > **Company Portal**, and configure the Company Portal settings.

trans-unit.source: admin-console-admin-workspace-comp-portal-settings
trans-unit.target: admin-console-admin-workspace-comp-portal-settings

trans-unit.source: Company contact information and privacy statement
trans-unit.target: Company contact information and privacy statement

trans-unit.source: The company name is displayed as the Company Portal title.
trans-unit.target: The company name is displayed as the Company Portal title.

trans-unit.source: The contact information and details are displayed to users in the Contact IT screen of the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: The contact information and details are displayed to users in the Contact IT screen of the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: The privacy statement is displayed when a user clicks the privacy link.
trans-unit.target: The privacy statement is displayed when a user clicks the privacy link.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Max length
trans-unit.target: Max length

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Company name
trans-unit.target: Company name

trans-unit.source: This name is displayed as the title of the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: This name is displayed as the title of the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: Alpha-numeric characters only.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: Alpha-numeric characters only.

trans-unit.source: This field doesn't support special characters.
trans-unit.target: This field doesn't support special characters.

trans-unit.source: IT department contact name
trans-unit.target: IT department contact name

trans-unit.source: This name is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.
trans-unit.target: This name is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.

trans-unit.source: IT department phone number
trans-unit.target: IT department phone number

trans-unit.source: This contact number is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.
trans-unit.target: This contact number is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.

trans-unit.source: IT department email address
trans-unit.target: IT department email address

trans-unit.source: This contact address is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.
trans-unit.target: This contact address is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.

trans-unit.source: You must enter a valid email address in the format **alias@domainname.com**.
trans-unit.target: You must enter a valid email address in the format **alias@domainname.com**.

trans-unit.source: Additional information
trans-unit.target: Additional information

trans-unit.source: This information is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.
trans-unit.target: This information is displayed on the **Contact IT** page.

trans-unit.source: Company privacy statement URL
trans-unit.target: Company privacy statement URL

trans-unit.source: You can specify your own company privacy statement that appears when users click the privacy links from the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can specify your own company privacy statement that appears when users click the privacy links from the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: You must enter a valid URL in the format https://www.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: You must enter a valid URL in the format https://www.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Support contacts
trans-unit.target: Support contacts

trans-unit.source: The support website is displayed to users in the Company Portal to enable them to access online support.
trans-unit.target: The support website is displayed to users in the Company Portal to enable them to access online support.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Max length
trans-unit.target: Max length

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Support website URL
trans-unit.target: Support website URL

trans-unit.source: If you have a support website that you want your users to use, specify the URL here.
trans-unit.target: If you have a support website that you want your users to use, specify the URL here.

trans-unit.source: The URL must be in the format https://www.contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: The URL must be in the format https://www.contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: If you don't specify a URL, nothing is displayed for the support website on the **Contact IT** page in the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: If you don't specify a URL, nothing is displayed for the support website on the **Contact IT** page in the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: Website name
trans-unit.target: Website name

trans-unit.source: This name is the friendly name that is displayed for the URL to the support website.
trans-unit.target: This name is the friendly name that is displayed for the URL to the support website.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a support website URL and no friendly name, then **Go to IT website** is displayed on the **Contact IT** page in the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a support website URL and no friendly name, then **Go to IT website** is displayed on the **Contact IT** page in the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: Company branding customization
trans-unit.target: Company branding customization

trans-unit.source: You can customize your Company Portal with your company logo, company name, theme color, and background.
trans-unit.target: You can customize your Company Portal with your company logo, company name, theme color, and background.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Theme color
trans-unit.target: Theme color

trans-unit.source: Select a theme color to apply to the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: Select a theme color to apply to the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: Include company logo
trans-unit.target: Include company logo

trans-unit.source: When you enable this option, you can upload your company logo to show in your Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: When you enable this option, you can upload your company logo to show in your Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can upload two logos: one logo that is displayed when the Company Portal background is white, and one logo that is displayed when the Company Portal background uses your selected theme color.
trans-unit.target: You can upload two logos: one logo that is displayed when the Company Portal background is white, and one logo that is displayed when the Company Portal background uses your selected theme color.

trans-unit.source: Each logo must be a .png or .jpg file, have a maximum resolution of 400 x 100 pixels, and be 750 KB or less in size.
trans-unit.target: Each logo must be a .png or .jpg file, have a maximum resolution of 400 x 100 pixels, and be 750 KB or less in size.

trans-unit.source: Choose a background for [!INCLUDE[win8_client_2](../includes/win8_client_2_md.md)] Company Portal app
trans-unit.target: Choose a background for [!INCLUDE[win8_client_2](../includes/win8_client_2_md.md)] Company Portal app

trans-unit.source: This setting affects the background for the [!INCLUDE[win8_client_2](../includes/win8_client_2_md.md)] Company Portal app only.
trans-unit.target: This setting affects the background for the [!INCLUDE[win8_client_2](../includes/win8_client_2_md.md)] Company Portal app only.

trans-unit.source: After you save your changes, you can use the links that are provided at the bottom of the **Company Portal** page of the administration console to view the Company Portal website.
trans-unit.target: After you save your changes, you can use the links that are provided at the bottom of the **Company Portal** page of the administration console to view the Company Portal website.

trans-unit.source: These links cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: These links cannot be changed.

trans-unit.source: When a user signs in, these links display your subscriptions in the Company Portal.
trans-unit.target: When a user signs in, these links display your subscriptions in the Company Portal.

trans-unit.source: Assign an Intune user license
trans-unit.target: Assign an Intune user license

trans-unit.source: You use the **Office 365 management portal** to manually add cloud-based users and assign licenses to both cloud-based user accounts and accounts that are synchronized from your on-premises Active Directory to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: You use the **Office 365 management portal** to manually add cloud-based users and assign licenses to both cloud-based user accounts and accounts that are synchronized from your on-premises Active Directory to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Office 365 management portal](https://portal.office.com/Admin/Default.aspx) by using your tenant administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Office 365 management portal](https://portal.office.com/Admin/Default.aspx) by using your tenant administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: Select the user account that you want to assign an Intune user license to, and then select the **Microsoft Intune** check box on the user account properties.
trans-unit.target: Select the user account that you want to assign an Intune user license to, and then select the **Microsoft Intune** check box on the user account properties.

trans-unit.source: The user account will now be added to the Microsoft Intune user group, which grants the user permissions to use the service and enroll their devices into management.
trans-unit.target: The user account will now be added to the Microsoft Intune user group, which grants the user permissions to use the service and enroll their devices into management.

trans-unit.source: Set up device management
trans-unit.target: Set up device management

trans-unit.source: After setting up the MDM authority, you need to set up device management for the operating systems that your organization wants to support.
trans-unit.target: After setting up the MDM authority, you need to set up device management for the operating systems that your organization wants to support.

trans-unit.source: The steps that are required to set up device management vary by operating system.
trans-unit.target: The steps that are required to set up device management vary by operating system.

trans-unit.source: For example, the Android OS does not require you to do anything in the Intune administration console.
trans-unit.target: For example, the Android OS does not require you to do anything in the Intune administration console.

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, Windows and iOS require a trust relationship between devices and Intune to allow management.
trans-unit.target: On the other hand, Windows and iOS require a trust relationship between devices and Intune to allow management.

trans-unit.source: Set up management for the following platforms:
trans-unit.target: Set up management for the following platforms:

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: iOS and Mac
trans-unit.target: iOS and Mac

trans-unit.source: Windows PCs and laptops
trans-unit.target: Windows PCs and laptops

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 Mobile and Windows Phone

trans-unit.source: You can also:
trans-unit.target: You can also:

trans-unit.source: Use the [device enrollment manager account](enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune.md) to enroll many devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the [device enrollment manager account](enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune.md) to enroll many devices.

trans-unit.source: [Specify company-owned devices by using IMEI numbers](specify-corporate-owned-devices-with-international-mobile-equipment-identity-imei-numbers.md) to help enroll devices and target policy.
trans-unit.target: [Specify company-owned devices by using IMEI numbers](specify-corporate-owned-devices-with-international-mobile-equipment-identity-imei-numbers.md) to help enroll devices and target policy.
